text.0: the youthful mother keeps the boy in secret pressed to her close nor yields him to the father.
text.1: but when he lies upon the arm the people see his unfading countenance before them.
text.2: what child is this thou carriest as handmaid o youthful one the consortqueen hath borne him.
text.3: the babe unborn increased through many autumns i saw him born what time his mother bare him.
text.4: i saw him from afar goldtoothed brightcoloured hurling his weapons from his habitation.
text.5: what time i gave him amṛta free from mixture how can the indraless the hymnless harm me.
text.6: i saw him moving from the place he dwells in even as with a herd brilliantly shining.
text.7: these seized him not he had been born already they who were grey with age again grow youthful.
text.8: who separate my young bull from the cattle they whose protector was in truth no stranger.
text.9: let those whose hands have seized upon them free them may he observant drive the herd to usward.
text.10: mid mortal men godless have secreted the king of all who live home of the people.
text.11: so may the prayers of atri give him freedom reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.
text.12: thou from the stake didst loose een Śunaḥśepa bound for a thousand for he prayed with fervour.
text.13: so agni loose from us the bonds that bind us when thou art seated here o priest who knowest.
text.14: thou hast sped from me agni in thine anger this the protector of gods laws hath told me.
text.15: indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee by him instructed am i come o agni.
text.16: agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour and by his greatness makes all things apparent.
text.17: he conquers godless and malign enchantments and sharpens both his horns to gore the rakṣas.
text.18: loud in the heaven above be agnis roarings with keenedged weapons to destroy the demons.
text.19: forth burst his splendours in the somas rapture the godless bands press round but cannot stay him.
text.20: as a skilled craftsman makes a car a singer i mighty one this hymn for thee have fashioned.
text.21: if thou o agni god accept it gladly may we obtain thereby the heavenly waters.
text.22: may he the strongnecked steer waxing in vigour gather the foemans wealth with none to check him.
text.23: thus to this agni have the immortals spoken to man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.
